ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Skills regarding research analysis and synthesis.
I learned how to report and talk about my research work with peers and faculty
got to hear my fellow cog sci majors theses, got some feedback on my project
This was the senior colloquium and we heard people present about their thesis, which was cool
I enjoyed hearing about my fellow peer's projects.
I really enjoyed hearing everyone's thesis research

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Well structured to facilitate student engagement.
The course is really well set up for people to have enough time to work on their own projects, while getting the chance to appreciate the work of others

strength: each week was shorter than 2 hours (not the full class time), was cool to hear others' work, Isaac is a chill and nice guy
weakness: not enough consistent feedback honestly, it feels like a lot of this feedback would be helpful much earlier in the year though since people have already done their experiments or whatever they are basing the thesis on (having it be a one-time thing was just kinda ehhh), was annoying that some people just didn't pay attention/on their computer doing work they should've been responsible with
Was fun to hear about people's thesis research
Wish there were deadlines for more developed drafts earlier in the semester

The cogsci senior essay is very well-structured, especially relative to other majors. 
The clear milestones (including a thesis draft due midsemester) are an excellent accountability measure to keep you writing on schedule, and the group presentations were uniformly enjoyable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially to CogSci majors who need it.
I recommend this to anyone in the Cognitive Science major!

It's required, (echoing others in previous years) this class is kinda helpful but not really. Spending 2 hours with my advisor weekly would have been much more helpful since I spent this class time every week just to hear 15 minutes of questions/debate regarding my thesis. Kinda a joke in terms of time efficiency. It's cool to hear others' stuff, but at what cost, you know?
Yep if you're a cogsci major you have to take it, if you're not you're not allowed to take it.
Yes, love the cog sci major!
